messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How many km to Golden Gate Bridge?
Sure—could you tell me the location (city, address, or latitude/longitude) you’d like to measure the distance from?

No problem. To work out the distance, I need a starting point (even an approximate one). Here are some easy ways you can find or estimate your current location:

1. Phone or tablet  
   • On most smartphones you can open Google Maps (or Apple Maps) and tap the blue dot that shows where you are; the latitude/longitude appears if you press and hold on the dot or swipe up on its info card.  
   • Copy the coordinates shown (e.g., 37.7749 N, –122.4194 W).

2. Laptop or desktop  
   • Open google.com/maps, click the small “target” icon in the bottom-right corner (“Your location”).  
   • Right-click the blue dot that appears ➜ select “What’s here?”; coordinates appear at the bottom.

3. Just tell me a nearby landmark or city  
   • If you at least know the city, neighborhood, or a well-known landmark you’re near (e.g., “downtown San Jose, CA” or “Union Square, San Francisco”), I can give an approximate distance.

Let me know whichever of those you can provide, and I’ll calculate roughly how many kilometers it is to the Golden Gate Bridge.
Turned on location service and found out I'm near downtown San Francisco.

Starting from central/downtown San Francisco (≈ 37.7749 °N, –122.4194 °W) to the Golden Gate Bridge’s south tower (≈ 37.8199 °N, –122.4783 °W) is about:

• 7.2 km (≈ 4.5 miles) in a straight line (“as-the-crow-flies”).

Actual travel distance will be longer—around 6–7 km if you walk or bike via the Embarcadero / Marina route, and roughly 8–10 km by car depending on the streets and on-ramp you use.
